description.narrative: The good governance support program began in July 2008 and runs until June 2013. The program follows two phases of support to good governance and focusses on three components: Component 1 supports (i) the National Land Commission in the implementation of the 2007 land law including development of a pro-poor national land policy, an updated land registry and cadastral (re) measurements of the entire country, and (ii) the Royal Court of Justice in enhancing access to justice for all including vulnerable groups including the construction of a new district court in Trashigang, capacity building, organizational development and alternative dispute resolution. Component 2 consists of support to strengthening decentralization process in Bhutan, including block grant for local investments, improving the management of public expenditure (from planning and budgeting for monitoring and evaluation) as well as capacity building and training of local authorities. Component 3 consists of support for civil society organizations and support for the civil society organisation authority.
